item.title: Quarkus 2.7.1.Final released - Maintenance release
item.description: Today, we released Quarkus 2.7.1.Final, our first maintenance release for our 2.7 release train. It contains bugfixes and documentation improvements, but also a couple of new features, filling a few gaps. It is a safe upgrade for anyone already using 2.7. If you are not using 2.7 already, please refer...
item.author: Guillaume Smet (https://twitter.com/gsmet_)

item.author: James Cobb (https://twitter.com/insectengine)

item.title: Quarkus 2.7.0.Final released - Quarkus CLI maturing, Interactive terminal, Oracle Reactive SQL Client...
item.description: 2-2-2022 would have been a perfect day to release a 2.2.2.Final version of Quarkus but we didn’t get that lucky. Today we announce the release of Quarkus 2.7.0.Final. 2.7.0.Final comes with a lot of refinements and new features: Lots of improvements for the Quarkus CLI, that has now been published...
item.author: Guillaume Smet (https://twitter.com/gsmet_)

item.title: Quarkus 2.6.3.Final released - Maintenance release
item.description: We just released Quarkus 2.6.3.Final with a new round of bugfixes and documentation improvements. It is a safe upgrade for anyone already using 2.6. Full changelog If you are not using 2.6 already, please refer to the 2.6 migration guide. You can get the full changelog of 2.6.3.Final on GitHub....
item.author: Guillaume Smet (https://twitter.com/gsmet_)

item.title: Quarkus Newsletter #16 - January
item.description: The January Newsletter has been published! This month, you can find articles about the Java InfoQ Trend report for December 2021, how to use Quarkus with the service binding operator, how to run Qurkus applications on Kubernetes, and lessons learned migrating Spring Boot to Quarkus. Check out Newsletter #16! Want...
item.author: James Cobb (https://twitter.com/insectengine)

item.title: Ask (Quark)us anything!
item.description: Time for our semi-annually Q&A session where we drive the episode using your questions! To submit questions comment on this blog or the matching post in our GitHub Discussion forum or post a tweet using the hashtag #quarkusinsights. If an existing question is of interest do upvote questions found in...
item.author: Max Rydahl Andersen (https://twitter.com/maxandersen)

item.title: Creating a Quarkus extension for AWS CloudWatch
item.description: Creating a Quarkus extension for AWS CloudWatch We recently had the situation that we wanted to log our Quarkus application logs to AWS CloudWatch. Basically it takes some time but is not a big deal. Adding a CloudWatch dependency, creating a Log Handler and push the logs to CloudWatch via...
item.author: Bennet Schulz (https://twitter.com/bennetelli)

item.title: Quarkus 2.6.2.Final released - Maintenance release
item.description: We just released Quarkus 2.6.2.Final, our second maintenance release for our 2.6 release train. It is a safe upgrade for anyone already using 2.6 and contains small bugfixes, tweaks and documentation improvements. It also brings back a working Kogito stack. Due to some infrastructure problems, the Kogito team wasn’t able...
item.author: Guillaume Smet (https://twitter.com/gsmet_)

item.title: Quarkus 2.6.1.Final released - Maintenance release
item.description: 2021 has been a tremendous year for Quarkus and today we officially close our 2021 release season with the last maintenance release of the year: 2.6.1.Final is available on Maven Central and ready for consumption! It is a safe upgrade for anyone already using 2.6 and contains dozens of small...
item.author: Guillaume Smet (https://twitter.com/gsmet_)

item.title: Quarkus 2.6.0.Final released - SmallRye Reactive Messaging 3.13 and Kafka 3, programmatic API for caching, Kotlin 1.6 and a lot more!
item.description: It is my great pleasure to announce the release of Quarkus 2.6.0.Final which comes with some nice changes: Some extensions moved to Quarkiverse Hub SmallRye Reactive Messaging 3.13 and Kafka 3 Programmatic API for caching Smaller image for native executables Built-in UPX compression AWT extension Kotlin 1.6 Camel 3.14 Due...
item.author: Guillaume Smet (https://twitter.com/gsmet_)
